intro: Lacinaria cylindracea f. solitaria, commonly known as the solitary cylinder lacinaria, is a unique variant of the species Lacinaria cylindracea. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its distinctive cylindrical stems and reduced foliage. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit, with solitary inflorescences that are often borne on elongated peduncles. Its botanical features include small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. This form is notable for its rarity and is often found in specific habitats, such as moist meadows or rocky areas.
